title: Rãs
body: Two species of these amphibians are known in Madeira: the *Rana temporaria* and the *Hyla arborea*. The former, introduced by the former Count of Carvalhal in the first quarter of the 19th century, now lives in almost all the ponds on the island; the latter, a small green species, lives in the trees of some gardens in Funchal, and the time of its introduction is unknown.

Conde do Carvalhal: Introduced the species *Rana temporaria* in Madeira

Século XIX: Introduction of the species *Rana temporaria* in Madeira
